entry.title: VS Code Python Environment Setup forÂ Students
entry.summary: This article is about adopting VS Code in an Education Environment
entry.content:
Me along with my colleagues Prof.Veena and Prof.Asha Rani were discussing which IDE (Integrated Development Environment) has to be recommended for students to code their Python projects.

We had two challengers in front of us.

First is the PyCharm Professional edition which is available for free to the students if they are able to provide their institutional email address.

Second is the VS Code which is open source and available for everyone.

After lot of deliberation, we thought of recommending the VS Code to students.

The advantages that tilted towards the adaptation of VS Code are below

  1. VS Code is used by huge pool of developers.

  2. One editor for all development environments including Python Programming, Web Programming, Java Programming and others.

  3. Availability of a number of extensions that can extend the functionality of VS Code. Extensions for customizing VS Code, remote development, linting, and debugging.

  4. VS Code is lightweight and open source.

  5. VS Code is industry standard. The knowledge of using VS Code can be carried from academia to the industry by the students.

Students are highly recommended to install the following packages to setup a Python Development Environement.
